page.title: 10Mills
page.content: Longwick Mill dates back to the l7th Century and stands on the stream between Longwick and Princes Risborough. When the railway was built the high embankment carrying it cut the mill pond in two. Nowadays modern machinery works the mill grinding animal foodstuffs. It is a family business employing three generations. The owners sell to customers from the forecourt and also have a delivery business. Some local crops as well as North American maize and fish meal and soya meal are ground. North Mill, right at the lower west edge of the area, used to be a timber mill but now is the home of a small construction company specialising in the erection of street lighting. There is still a timber yard nearby next to the mill stream.
